TERMS AND CONDITIONS
General
Prices indicated will be in effect from the date on the cover and are subject to change without notice. If, under any law now or
hereafter passed, the seller is required to pay a tax on sales or an excise tax, the amount of these taxes will be added to the
invoice value. We shall not be responsible for any loss or damage resulting from delay in filling orders caused by fire, flood, strikes,
differences with workmen, government regulations, accidents, transportation delays, shortages of materials, or other causes beyond
our control. Should raw material prices rise substantially, it may become necessary to add a surcharge by material type at the time
of shipment. Orders are processed in order of receipt, but lead times will vary in relation to production specifications. Errors or
omissions in published prices are subject to correction.
Payments
Credit is established at time of customer setup and evaluated periodically with standard terms of Net 30 pending credit worthiness. 
Accounts unpaid at expiration of 60 days from due date of invoice will be subject to a late payment charge of 1.5% per month of the 
total balance. Accounts with unpaid invoices beyond 60 days from due date of invoice will be subject to C.O.D. shipments. Accounts 
with unpaid invoices beyond 90 days from due date of invoice will be subject to 3rd party collection placement. All collection charges, 
attorney fees, and court costs will be added to the amount due. An NSF (insufficient fund) check fee in the amount of $50.00 will be 
added to the account. Credit card payments will incur a 3.0% administrative processing charge. Credit card payments may not be 
accepted in all situations or locations.
Minimum Order Charges
Orders with a net value of less than $250.00 will be invoiced a $50.00 flat fee.
Minimum Annual Purchase Requirement
A minimum annual amount of $25,000.00 is required to maintain open account status with Hager Companies.
Packaging
- A charge of $175.00 net will be made when requested to itemize and special package in accordance with such schedules.
- A charge of $100.00 net will be made when requested to make changes on itemized jobs after the orders have been processed.
- A charge of $50.00 net for crating certain products will be added to invoices at time of shipment.
Shipments and Freight Charges
All shipments are F.O.B. Point of Origin. Freight prepaid on shipments having a value of $5,000.00 net or more, route of our
selection. Less than $5,000.00 net shipped prepay and add. Shipments by Express, Air Freight, or United Parcel Service are F.O.B.
Point of Origin, without any freight allowance. Any request for shipments not falling under these guidelines may be subject
to a handling charge. Hager will not provide consignee or third party freight billing.
There will be a $25.00 net charge for furnishing proof of delivery receipt. This charge will be canceled if delivery was not made. 
Proof of delivery may be obtained by visiting www.hagerco.com and establishing an account with “My Hager.” Due to size limitations 
by certain carriers, some orders may require LTL shipment.
Please note that for next day air shipments, written consent with an authorized signature must be sent via fax or e-mail to Hager
Companies before an order will be released for overnight delivery. Next day air requests must be received prior to 1:00 p.m. CDT.


--- PAGE 4 ---
General Information
3
March 2025
www.hagerco.com
Miscellaneous Charges
All miscellaneous charges such as lift gate, re-delivery, re-consignment, and dock waiting fees may be invoiced separately, after
the initial invoice date. Hager will not be responsible for any additional charges billed by the freight carrier for extended delivery wait times, 
redelivery, or other similar charges.
- A charge of $50.00 net will be applied if quote is not submitted at time of order requiring changes.
- A charge of $50.00 net will be applied if incorrect account number is provided requiring changes.
Cancellations and Make-to-Order Items
Orders for non-stock goods, accepted by Hager, are non-cancelable except with prior written consent, and then subject to a service charge
based on the manufacturing expenses incurred. Under no circumstances will non-stock, make-to-order or discontinued product be accepted
for return unless it is due to a Hager error.
A. Rights of Return:
1. Restrictions: Unless the Customer has a separate written agreement with Hager Companies, the return of product purchased from
Hager is subject to the following restrictions:
	
a. Authorized Returns Only: No credit will be issued for returned goods unless such return is authorized by our St. Louis
	
office. All returns are subject to review and approval by Sales Management and will be handled on an account by account basis.
	
b. Return Goods Authorization Document: Product will not be accepted unless it is accompanied by a Return Goods
	
Authorization RGA). No RGA will be issued for less than $25.00.
	
c. 35% Restocking Fee: All returns are subject to a minimum 35% handling and restocking fee at Hager Companies sole
	
discretion.
	
d. Timeline for Product Returns: The timeline for returns is as follows:
	
	
i. 	
North American Shipments (U.S., Canada, Mexico, Puerto Rico)
	
	
	
1. Notification to Hager – within 6 months from date of shipment.
	
	
	
2. Receipt of return by Hager – within 60 days of notification to Hager.
	
	
ii. 	
International Shipments
	
	
	
1. Notification to Hager - within 6 months from date of shipment.
	
	
	
2. Receipt of return by Hager - within 120 days from notification.
	
e. Condition: Return goods, and packaging, must be in sellable condition or no credit will be issued, and goods will be destroyed.
	
f. Direct Returns Only: Return goods authorization must be requested directly by the Hager Companies customer. Third party
	
customers will not be allowed to return product and all unauthorized merchandise will be returned to the sender and the Hager
	
customer will be invoiced for additional shipping charges incurred.
2. Return Shipping: Freight terms will be specified on the RGA. The Customer is responsible for shipping charges and risk of loss and
damage on all return shipments.
3. Replacement Order and Credit: The Customer may return product and Hager Companies will assist in its replacement or grant credit
against future purchases in an amount equal to the original purchase price and freight paid for the product less any applicable
restocking fees.
4. Non-Returnable Merchandise: Returns are also subject to the additional policies below. If the Customer fails to return Product within
the applicable return policy period or if the Product does not meet the criteria under this Return Policy, the Product is considered
accepted by the Customer and not returnable.
B. Freight Damaged Products: In the event that packages are damaged during transit to customer, please follow the guidelines in the
Hager Freight Policy.
1. 	 If damaged products (noted and/or concealed) are accepted from the Carrier, contact Hager Companies Customer service
	
within 5 calendar days after receipt of shipment to arrange for carrier inspection and a pickup of the damaged products.
2. 	 As per the Hager Companies’ Freight Policy, all damages must be noted on the carrier delivery record prior to the driver
	
leaving the Customer premises. Please save the Product and all original packaging. Timely notification of the damage is necessary
	
to file a damage claim with the freight carrier and avoid delays in returns and replacements.

C. Order Quantity Discrepancies: All order discrepancies (shortages or overages) must be reported to the Hager Companies Customer
Service Department within 5 calendar days of receipt of shipment.
1. 	
Defective Product: Report defective product to the Hager Companies Customer Service for processing.
2. 	
Non-Returnable Product (not all inclusive): The following Products cannot be returned to Hager Companies:
	
	
a. Discontinued Items
	
	
b. Special Order Items
	
	
c. Open items, and/or items needing re-packaging
	
	
d. Items in an unsuitable resale condition
D. Process:
All items being returned must have a Hager Companies Return Goods Authorization Number. If the return meets the Hager Companies return
guidelines, you may obtain an RGA # by contacting:
Hager Companies Customer Service
Phone: 800-325-9995
E-Mail: rga_connect@hagerco.com
Warranty Returns
A credit in the amount of the original purchase order will be issued after the returned product is inspected and the defect is found to be valid.
Inspection and Delivery
Customer will inspect all product deliveries immediately upon receipt. Hager will assume acceptance of delivered product if not notified within
5 days of receipt of product.
Claims
All claims should be submitted to Hager as follows:
- All claims for pricing adjustments must be submitted within 30 days of invoice date
- All claims for order quantity discrepancies must be submitted within 5 days
- All claims for damaged material prior to acceptance by customer must be submitted within 5 days
Limited Warranty
Subject to the limitations of liability set forth below, Hager Companies (the “Company”) warrants to purchasers that the products which
the Company sells under the “Hager” trademark or trade name are free from defects in workmanship and materials under normal use and
regular service and maintenance from date of delivery.
This is the sole and exclusive warranty given by the company with respect to the products and is in lieu of any and all other warranties,
express or implied, arising by operation of law or otherwise. All implied warranties, including but not limited to the warranties of
merchantability, non-infringement and fitness for a particular purpose, are hereby excluded.
This warranty does not cover defects or damage arising from improper installation, incorrect application, lack of or improper maintenance,
improper storage, shipping and handling, excessive wear and tear, misuse, abuse, accident, unauthorized service, or
use with unauthorized products or parts.

Commercial Hinges
Whenever possible, Hager Companies employs the latest technologies in metal finishing to provide the best long-term performance for our 
customers. Some finishes may not comply completely with BHMA (Builders Hardware Manufacturing Association) Standard A156.18 
specifications with regard to plating process. However, they match BHMA color standards and exceed all BHMA performance criteria with regard to 
such tests as salt spray corrosion resistance, ultraviolet light deterioration resistance, solvent resistance, perspiration resistance, and finish hardness. 
For the convenience of our customers, we refer to the most appropriate finish symbols to indicate similarity of appearance using BHMA standard 
nomenclature including the “US” and numerical designation. Dissimilar metals are plated to match or be compatible to the finishes indicated. Finish 
numbers indicated on each product are the most equivalent to the old “US” symbol numbers and carry the BHMA finish symbol in parenthesis 
adjacent to the finish: Example — US3 (605) - Bright Brass or US26D (626) - Satin Chrome.
Hager’s finishes are durable, high quality finishes obtained by careful processing of steel, brass, and stainless steel materials. It is important to 
consider usage and climatic conditions when selecting finishes. This is especially true in areas subjected to strong corrosive chemical conditions, 
humid climate or salt air which may have a damaging effect on metal finishes in a very short period of time. The longevity and preservation of the 
finish appearance are determined by base metal and finish process.
Care and maintenance of clear protective coatings or other organic finishing applications may require different methods of cleaning and care. As an 
example, all hardware finishes should not be cleaned with solvents or abrasives; surfaces should periodically be cleaned with a mild, non-abrasive 
soap and dried lightly with a soft, clean cloth. The type of base material and finishing techniques must be considered when applying any cleaning or 
preservative method. Contact Hager’s Sales and Service Department for further information on the care of hardware finishes.
Note:  Hager only warrants US10B finish over brass or bronze base material. If steel base material is necessary, Hager recommends US10A         
lacquer finish.

In the event you do not find the particular hinge which will meet your 
requirements, we recommend that you contact Hager Companies Sales 
and Service and provide us with your specification.  
Special Screws
All butt hinges are regularly packed with flat Phillips head wood or 
machine screws or bolts.  All other types are special.

INTRODUCTION
Hager door controls offer architects, contractors, and building owners a superior product with proven reliability. In fact, our 5100, 5200, 
and 5300 Series Grade 1 models are the only closers in the industry that are both BHMA certified and backed by a lifetime warranty. 
That makes them a no-risk choice for virtually any building type.
With Hager, you get door controls that are packaged with everything needed for quick installation, regardless of the application. Hager 
door closers are tri-packed for mounting three ways: parallel arm, regular arm, and top jamb. They are non-handed, packaged with a 
parallel arm bracket and thru-bolts at no extra charge, and adjustable for various door sizes.
Cancellation Notification
Cancellation for made-to-order items must be communicated within 48 hours of order placement. 
Note: Less popular finishes and/or arm configurations may result in extended lead times & minimum order requirements.

Exit Devices
INTRODUCTION
Every model in Hager’s line of exit devices is designed and engineered to assure you and your customers years of superior 
performance. Hager exit devices use fewer moving parts and are constructed with high-quality features.
Hager exit devices were designed with ease of installation in mind. We package our exit devices for convenience and versatility, with
thru-bolts included for every model, slotted strikes, and non-handed designs. Hager offers escutcheon trim available in four functions,
along with many other trim options.
Cancellation Notification
Cancellation for made-to-order items must be communicated within 48 hours of order placement.

Two internal SPDT switches that monitors the pushbar and outside trim

Delayed Egress
DE
Delays egress for 15 or 30 seconds when unauthorized egress is initiated. Wall mount 
controller (2-679-0630) provides digital countdown display with verbal instructions or 
alarm tone only and must be ordered separately, list price $1,011.20. Requires 3902 
Mortise Cylinder, 1-1/8” long. Longer cylinders can be used with a collar.
$1,678.27
Onboard Delayed Egress
OBDE
Delays egress for 15 or 30 seconds when unauthorized egress is initiated. Required 
3902 Mortise Cylinder, 1-1/8” long. Longer cylinders can be used with a collar.
$3,767.65

Retraction
MLR

motor. Recommend Hager 2903 or 2904 Power Supply.

Retraction with Request to Exit
MLRX

motor, along with an SPDT switch. Recommend Hager 2903 or 2904 Power Supply.
$1,952.50

Retraction with Request to Exit

motor, along with two internal SPDT switches that monitor the pushbar and latchbolt 
simultaneously. Recommend Hager 2903 or 2904 Power Supply.
$1,952.50
Motor Driven Electric Latch 
Retraction with Latchbolt 
Monitoring
MLRLM
Provides the means of locking or unlocking  exit devices remotely using an electric 
motor along with an internal SPDT switch that monitors the latchbolt. Recommend 
Hager 2903 or 2904 Power Supply.
$1,550.81

ELEU

Locks
INTRODUCTION
Hager Companies offers a variety of locks to meet a wide range of applications and solutions. Heavy Duty Grade 1 deadlocks, 
cylindrical locks, and mortise locks are ideal for schools, hospitals, and other high-use environments. Grade 2 deadlocks and cylindrical 
locks are ideal for less abusive environments, while Grade 2 tubular locks are suitable for heavy duty residential or medium duty 
commercial environments.
All Hager locks have been rigorously tested and certified to the highest standards. Most lock series are BHMA certified per the ANSI 
A156.2 standards. They are also UL/cUL Listed for all functions up to and including 3 hours for “A” labeled doors. In addition to the 
certifications, all Hager Grade 1 and Grade 2 leversets are ADA compliant and most come with a lifetime warranty.
Most Hager locksets are either non-handed or field reversible in the case of the 3800 Series mortise lock. Conventional cylinder and 
small format interchangeable core are available on keyed functions. Most lock series offer three lever style options along with one knob 
style. Please check appropriate section for series specific options.
CANCELLATION NOTIFICATION 
Cancellation for made-to-order items must be communicated within 48 hours of order placement.

INTRODUCTION
Hager Roton hinges are unique, aluminum geared hinges developed to outperform most other entrance components because the 
weight of the door is distributed along the full length of the door frame.
Roton continuous hinges have been utilized in hospitals, schools, hotels, offices, airports, stadiums, storefronts, and commercial and
industrial buildings in new construction and retrofit applications for over 30 years.
Hager Roton continuous geared hinges are designed for superior performance. Because of this, we offer our lifetime warranty with
confidence.
ANSI Standards
• 780 Series Roton continuous geared hinges are approved per ANSI A156.26 Grade 1 for 150 lb. doors
• 780 Series Roton heavy duty hinges are approved per ANSI A156.26 Grade 1 for 300 lb. doors
• 780-111, 780-112, 780-124HD, 780-224, 780-226 standard duty and heavy duty Roton continuous geared hinges are
Warnock-Hersey certified in accordance with ANSI A250.13 2003 Standard Severe Windstorm Resistant Components.
Cancellation Notification
Cancellation for made to order items must be completed within 48 hours of order placement.

Roton Continuous Hinges
Standard Lengths
Roton hinges are listed and priced as actual lengths 79” (6’8” opening), 83” (7’0” opening), 85” (7’2” opening), 95” (8’0” opening),
and 119” (10’0” opening) for convenience in application to nominal sized doors. Actual length provides for threshold clearance, head
clearance and door height allowances for carpeting. Other lengths may be ordered as non-standard items.
Special Lengths
Should a non-standard length be required, please price as the next standard length.
(For example, if 86” length is required, use 95” list price.) 
Length Specifications
If special lengths to match the actual net door heights are required, please indicate this clearly on your order. A special length should
be specified from the net door height, not the nominal height of the opening. To order specify: “Actual Length”, or “Net Door Height”.
Use pricing for the next longer standard length from which the special length can be manufactured. For example, hinges 86-3/4” long
will be invoiced at the 95” price.
Field Modifications
While Roton hinges can be cut in the field, any product modifications may void all warranties. Should in-the-field modifications be
required, cut only from bottom of hinge. Do not cut through bearings or screw holes. When cutting electric hinges it is extremely
important to clamp both hinge leaves securely to prevent hinge “chatter” which can damage the hinge’s internal wiring.
Consult the St. Louis sales office before proceeding.
Template Hinges
Hager has developed templated hole patterns for Roton hinge models in standard lengths. Drawings are available upon request by
contacting Hager Customer Service or accessing the Hager website at www.hagerco.com.
Due to normal variances inherent in the manufacturing process, Roton custom length hinges are deemed by Hager to be nontemplated.
Standard Finishes
Roton hinges are available in clear anodized satin aluminum (similar to US28), dark bronze and black exterior anodized coating.
Special Products
A special product is any product not listed in the price book in regard to length, finish, standard hole preparation or leaf combinations
not illustrated. Orders for special products are encouraged, but any changes or cancellations on special orders may result in charges
related to work performed and/or material loss. Under no circumstance will non-stock or make-to-order products be accepted for
return unless due to Hager error.

FULLY CONCEALED WITH STUD
Fully Concealed
These models are concealed between the frame and the hinge edge of the door. Models available include:
780-041HD, 780-111, 780-111HD, 780-111LL, 780-112, 780-112HD, 780-112LL,
780--124HD, 780-124LL, 780-224, 780-224HD, 780-224LL, 780-226, 780-226HD, and 780-226LL.
HALF SURFACE WITH STUD
Half Surface
These models have the frame leaf concealed between the frame and the edge of the door. The door
leaf is mounted to the door with thru-bolts or screws. Models available include:
780-045HD, 780-046HD, 780-053, 780-053HD, and 780-054HD.
FULL SURFACE WITH STUD 
Full Surface
These models have the frame leaf mounted to the face of the frame and the face of the door. The door
leaf is mounted to the face of the door with thru-bolts. Models available include:
780-057HD, 780-157, 780-157HD, 780-210, and 780-210HD.

FIRE RATINGS - UNDERWRITERS LABORATORY FIRE RATING FILE #A14627
780 Series Roton continuous geared hinges with stainless steel studs are approved for use on 4’x10’ metal or 	
wood swing type doors.  780 Series Roton continuous geared hinges without stainless steel studs are approved 
for use on 4’x8’ single swing metal doors and 4’x10’ single swing wood doors used without stainless steel studs 
limited to 20 minute fire rating without hose stream.
 
•	 Hollow metal, tin-clad, sheet-metal and steel covered composite type rated up to and including 3 hours 
•	 Wood composite doors rated up to and including 1-1/2 hours 
•	 Wood core doors rated up to 20 minutes without hose stream, non-studded 
•	 780 Series Roton Continuous Geared Hinges meet requirements for positive pressure UL10C, UL10B and UBC7-2 Part 1

ANSI Standards
Hager Companies 790 Series stainless steel continuous hinges are approved for ANSI A156.26 Grade 1 for 150-pound doors
and Grade 2 for 300-pound doors for the following series: 790-900, 790-905, 790-915, 790-904, 790-906, 790-903.
Fire Rating
Hager 790 Series hinges are approved by Underwriters Laboratories, Inc. Fire Rated label for up to 3 hours for metal doors and         
90 minutes for wood composite doors.
Cancellation Notification
Cancellation for made-to-order items must be communicated within 48 hours of order placement. 
Standard Lengths
Stainless steel hinges are listed and priced as actual lengths 83-1/8” (7’0” opening), 85” (7’2” opening), 95” (8’0” opening), and 
119” (10’0” opening) for convenience in application to nominal sized doors.  Other lengths may be ordered as non-standard items.

PRODUCT INFORMATION
Drawings or illustrations used in the Price Book are subject to change without notice.  Questions regarding any dimensions should be 
directed to Hager Companies Customer Service.
MATERIALS AND FINISHES
Metals
All aluminum extrusions are of alloy 6063-T5. All bronze extrusions are of alloy CDA385 brass specified as Architectural Bronze in 
the industry.  For stock finishes, refer to the code listed below each individual item throughout the price book. Please inquire for the 
availability on non-stock finishes.
MIL-	
Mill Finish Aluminum	
LBA -	
Light Bronze Anodized Aluminum

Polished Bronze (CDA385)	
MIB-	
Mill Finish Bronze (CDA385)
CAL-	
Cast Aluminum	
GYP-	
Primed Steel (Grey)

Dark Bronze Anodized Aluminum	
BLA-	
Black Anodized Aluminum
SCA-	
Hager Carb-Coat on Aluminum	
32D-	
Matte Stainless Steel (Non-Extruded)
SCB-	
Hager Carb-Coat on Bronze	
WH-	
White Paint on Aluminum
10B-	
Antique Bronze, Oiled	
	
CLR-	Clear Anodized Aluminum
	
	
BCA-	
Bright Clear Anodized Aluminum
Gaskets
Gasketing is available in a wide variety of materials. Vinyl is an economical choice and remains flexible down to -40°F. Neoprene 
gasketing is supplied both as a solid (dense) and as a closed cell sponge with a tough outer skin, remaining flexible down to -50°F.  
Silicone gasketing provides the best resistance to cold by remaining flexible down to -70°F. To order gasket only, see how to order 
example on page 3.

FASTENERS
All products are furnished with appropriate fasteners as listed, except where noted.  Most thresholds are furnished with mounting 
holes and #10 x 1-1/2” flat head sheet metal screws. Most weatherstripping products are furnished with slotted holes and #6 x 
5/8” pan head sheet metal screws. Brass screws are furnished with bronze products.
FIRE LABELING
All products containing non-metallic seals have been listed and labeled resulting from a determination by a certified fire laboratory 
that these products do not adversely affect the fire resistance of the door or frame. All products are regularly checked under a 
labeling and listing inspection service.

RECOMMENDED SPECIAL INSTRUCTIONS:
Application:	
All accessory item installation should be made following the application of paint or other finishes. Under no 
	
circumstances should accessory items be installed prior to painting. Paint or other finish material must be dry before 
	
applying accessory items to door. Hager recommends that a 72 hour drying time be allowed prior to application of 
	
accessory items under normal atmospheric conditions.
Maintenance:	
For cleaning, use only a soft damp cloth. Do not use any chemicals, abrasive cleaners, waxes, or brass cleaners on 
	
items with a lacquer coating or on plastic plates.
